techmeme.title: China arrests a South Korean chip engineer on espionage charges, escalating the battle over IP theft between China and South Korea in the critical chip sector (Financial Times)
Samsung's stock has dropped 32% from its 2024 peak on July 9, cutting $122B off its market cap, more than any other chipmaker worldwide on AI and foundry woes (Bloomberg)
IDC: Samsung's global market share in Q3 fell from 21% to 18% YoY, the only one of the top five global smartphone makers to experience falling shipments (Financial Times)
Microsoft says Russian hackers have sent "highly targeted spearphishing emails" to thousands of US officials, defense workers, and others in a phishing campaign (Katrina Manson/Bloomberg)
Data: anti-government militia activity has grown on Facebook in the US, with the platform even auto-generating some group pages, despite the issue being flagged (Tess Owen/Wired)
